main event: On January 21, 1956, in Maywood, New Jersey, a plant guard observed a round object, the size of a medicine ball, emitting yellow, blue, and green mixed colors, with several tailing bodies behind the ball. The object seemed to be discharging gases. The observer estimated the speed of the object to be 500 m.p.h. and its distance at 10560 feet. The observation lasted for 15 seconds.
interesting points: The object emitted yellow, blue, and green mixed colors and seemed to be discharging gases.
The observer estimated the speed of the object to be 500 m.p.h. and its distance at 10560 feet.
The observer reported that the object appeared to gain speed, change colors, and then diminish rapidly as it moved away.
The witness was a 68+ year old male with no college education and described the object as some distance in the sky, with a bright glow several times the size of a large star.
The observer reported an unusual sound, described as a low rumble and hissing, in a most active state.
sighted object: One round object emitting yellow, blue, and green mixed colors, with tailing bodies behind it, and discharging gases.
witnesses: The witness was a 68+ year old male plant guard.
